I had a similar experience.  I was referred to a rheumatlogist for aworkup regarding costochondritis and other pain syndromes.  Hechecked my reflexes and they were all way beyond normal, they werehyperreflective.  He (the doc,) called his nurse and P.A. in to see my relexes, and the doctor said it was due to my thyroid.,  Wel, I havebeen taking thyroid since 1985, but the hyper reflexes told him I was on way too much medication and stop it immediately.  I called my regular internist and saw him. He said I have what is called centra hypothyroidism, meaning my pituitary gland doesn't tell my thyrid to make thyroid, and that the test in this disease is not interpreted the same.  Who knows, it's always something, and it seems it's left up tous to get the correct answer and not just rely on one persons opinion.I'd suggest you have a serious discussion with your doctor about thyroid disease.
